intro: Hexastylis, commonly known as the sweetroot or Indian tobacco, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aristolochiaceae. It consists of about 15 species, most of which are native to eastern North America and the Caribbean. The plants are herbaceous perennials that typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
